bibl.title: Egypt in the Byzantine World, 300-700.
bibl.note: 21 contributions (most of them originally given as papers at the annual Byzantine Studies Symposium of Dumbarton Oaks in spring 2004). - Part I. The Culture of Byzantine Egypt. - Part II. Government, Environment, Society, and Economy. - Part. III. Christianity: The Church and Monasticism. - Part IV. Epilogue. - Pp. xiii: R.S.B., Preface; - 1-17: R.S.B., Introduction; - 460-464: Index.
bibl.seg: BAGNALL Roger S. (Ed.), Egypt in the Byzantine World, 300-700.
Cambridge, Cambridge University Press, 2007, 8°, xvi-464 pp., nombr. figg. ISBN 978-0-521-87137-2. £55.

21 contributions (most of them originally given as papers at the annual Byzantine Studies Symposium of Dumbarton Oaks in spring 2004). - Part I. The Culture of Byzantine Egypt. - Part II. Government, Environment, Society, and Economy. - Part. III. Christianity: The Church and Monasticism. - Part IV. Epilogue. - Pp. xiii: R.S.B., Preface; - 1-17: R.S.B., Introduction; - 460-464: Index.

C.R. par Shawn W.J. Keough, BMCRev < http://ccat.sas.upenn.edu/bmcr/2008/2008-09-57.html >. - Avshalom Laniado, SCI 27 (2008) pp. 173-176. - Clement A. Kuehn, BASP 46 (2009) pp. 175-187. - Ariel López, AntTard 17 (2009) pp. 359-363. - Peter Sarris, CR N.S., 60 (2010) pp. 193-196.
